item.title: Need explaining for/ or another Anti-Lag file
item.dc:creator: @xsaberjrx xsaberjrx
item.description:
@xsaberjrx wrote:

It restarts but it doesnt fix anything… basically it just restarts the server by logging everyone off and when you get restarted it leaves something in your folder so you have to add something to the end of your runserver.bat also to stop that from happening. I would suggest a scheduled task auto restart if you can find an endserver.bat. Unfortunately they are like… impossible to find

item.description:
@fireshadow299 wrote:

ok you see the if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
well change it to 600 sec for 10 min, 900 sec for 15 min ect
so it would look like this for 10 min

if(ResetTimer >= 600)

hope this helps

item.title: Need explaining for/ or another Anti-Lag file
item.dc:creator: @BlackBeast666 BlackBeast666
item.description:
@BlackBeast666 wrote:

I’ve now this Anti-Lag of resetting the server every 30min.

[code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
closeListener();
runserver();
}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 99999999)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “runserver.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;
}
catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

But what do I’ve to change if I want to make 10 Mins of it?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 27, 2007, 05:34:15 PM[/size][hr]Anyone?

Read full topic
item.source: Need explaining for/ or another Anti-Lag file
